titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Tamiment Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-04-02T15:23-0400

change.item: Edited by Maggie Schreiner to reflect updated administrative information

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Frank Chandler (1903-1992) was a trade union and community activist. His original name was Frank Tschinder. Frank worked as a punch press operator in New Jersey before joining the army in 1942. He left the army with an honorable discharge in 1945.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains documents related to his service in the United States military, an application for citizenship, birth certificate, passport, and death certificate.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library does not have information about who owns copyright to this collection. Materials in this collection are expected to enter the public domain in 2062. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown, but the collection was likely donated by Henry Foner circa 1997. The accession number 1997.067 is associated with this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Frank Chandler Papers; TAM 286; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. Materials are in the order in which they were received from the donor.
